body_html:
@moskomule just so I understand, when you execute a cell in a Jupyter notebook with the line import torch, the kernel of the notebook dies, is that right?

I've faced the same thing, but I didn't manage to get the jupyter notebook run from gdb. Thanks the stack trace!
body_text:
@moskomule just so I understand, when you execute a cell in a Jupyter notebook with the line import torch, the kernel of the notebook dies, is that right?
I've faced the same thing, but I didn't manage to get the jupyter notebook run from gdb. Thanks the stack trace!
body:
@moskomule just so I understand, when you execute a cell in a Jupyter notebook with the line `import torch`, the kernel of the notebook dies, is that right?

I've faced the same thing, but I didn't manage to get the jupyter notebook run from gdb. Thanks the stack trace!
